contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the rule of Zedekiah. This can be stated explicitly. Alternate translation: "of the reign of Zedekiah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: of Zedekiah

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that they should have said what follows. Alternate translation: "They should have said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: They did not say

contextId.occurrenceNote: "There is no hope for us to restrain ourselves." This implies that they cannot stop themselves from running after other gods. Alternate translation: "We cannot stop ourselves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: It is hopeless

contextId.occurrenceNote: It can be made clear that they say this to Yahweh. "Yahweh, come and save us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Arise and save us

contextId.occurrenceNote: Blood on their clothes was evidence that they had killed people. Alternate translation: "The blood of innocent, poor people on your clothes shows that you are guilty of killing them" or "You are guilty of killing poor and innocent people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: The blood that was the life of innocent, poor people has been found on your clothes

contextId.occurrenceNote: The people of Israel will be sad because the army of Egypt will not be able protect them. Alternate translation: "You will be disappointed when Egypt does not protect you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: You will also be disappointed by Egypt

contextId.occurrenceNote: People made a lot of noise on the hills and mountains when they worshiped false gods. Alternate translation: "We made a confusing noise on the mountains while we worshiped them, but they did not help us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: a confusing noise from the mountains

contextId.occurrenceNote: It can be stated clearly that Yahweh says this. This is probably his reply to Jeremiah, telling why the battle is still happening. Alternate translation: "Yahweh replied, 'It is because of the foolishness of my people ... do not know to do good.'" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: For the foolishness of my people ... do not know to do good.

contextId.occurrenceNote: God speaks of the people of Judah as if they were a prostitute making herself look beautiful in order to attract men to her. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "Like a prostitute you dress in scarlet ... good jewelry ... eyes ... with paint" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: you dress in scarlet ... gold jewelry ... eyes ... with paint

contextId.occurrenceNote: In verses 10-13 Yahweh speaks to Israel's enemies. This can be made clear in the quotation. Alternate translation: "You enemies of Israel, go up onto her vineyards' terraces" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Go up onto her vineyards' terraces

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "the word" refers to God's message. Alternate translation: "God's message is not in them" or "the messages that they speak are not from God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the word is not in them

contextId.occurrenceNote: It can be stated clearly what kinds of things the prophets were talking about. Alternate translation: "so let the harm that the prophets talk about come to them" or "since the prophets say that bad things will happen to us, let those bad things happen to the prophets" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: so let what they say be done to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "these things" refers to sending armies to attack them. Alternate translation: "done all these things to harm us" or "sent foreign armies to attack us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: done all these things to us

contextId.occurrenceNote: The trembling would be because of fear, and being "before my face" represents being aware of who God is. Alternate translation: "or shake with fear because of me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: or tremble before my face

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "keeping the fixed weeks of the harvest" represents making sure that those weeks happen at the right time. Alternate translation: "making sure for us that the weeks of harvest happen when they are supposed to" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: keeping the fixed weeks of the harvest for us

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated more actively. Alternate translation: "People do terrible and horrible things" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Atrocities and horrors have occurred

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "the land" refers to the land of Israel.' Alternate translation: "in the land of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: in the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) the priests do not submit to God's authority. Alternate translation: "the priests rule by their own authority" or 2) the priests rule according to the directions of the prophets (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the priests rule with their own power

contextId.occurrenceNote: A trumpet is used as a warning that people will be attacked. Alternate translation: "Blow a trumpet in Tekoa to warn the people that they will be attacked" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Blow a trumpet in Tekoa

contextId.occurrenceNote: How the crushing will come can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "Enemies will come and crush you" or "Enemies will come and destroy you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: a great crushing is coming

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "against her" means "in order to attack Zion." Alternate translation: "they will set up tents all around Zion in order to attack it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: they will set up tents against her all around

contextId.occurrenceNote: It can be stated clearly that the kings say this. Alternate translation: "The kings say to their armies, 'Dedicate yourselves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Dedicate yourselves

contextId.occurrenceNote: The attacking army tries to ensure that their gods will help them during the war by performing ceremonies and making sacrifices to them. Alternate translation: "Prepare for war by purifying yourselves and sacrificing to the gods" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Dedicate yourselves to the gods for the battle

contextId.occurrenceNote: People often spoke of cities as if they were women. Her the word "her" refers to Jerusalem. Alternate translation: "the strong buildings of Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: her fortresses

contextId.occurrenceNote: It can be stated clearly who Yahweh says this to. Alternate translation: "Yahweh says this to the people of Israel" or "Yahweh says this to his people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh says this

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "paid no attention to my word" refers to not listening to what God said, and "rejected it" refers to refusing to obey God's law. Alternate translation: "They did not listen to what I said. Instead they disobeyed my law" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: They paid no attention to my word or law, but they instead rejected it

contextId.occurrenceNote: Their purpose can be made clear. Alternate translation: "a people is coming to attack you" or "an army is coming" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: a people is coming

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "set out in order" means that they have organized themselves and are riding in rows. The phrase "as men for battle" indicates that they are ready to fight. Alternate translation: "they are riding on horses in their assigned rows, and they are ready to fight against you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: they are riding on horses, set out in order as men for battle

contextId.occurrenceNote: God speaks of punishing his people as if they were silver and he was boiling the silver in a very hot fire. These phrases emphasize that the one boiling the metal was working very hard. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: The bellows are scorched by the fire that is burning them; the lead is consumed in the flames

contextId.occurrenceNote: The silver has so many impurities in it that the lead is used up before it can remove them all. This represents the people of Israel being so full of sin, that they continue to sin even after God punishes them. Alternate translation: "the silver is so full of impurities, that the lead that is used to remove them is used up" or "they are like silver that is so full of impurities that the lead cannot remove them all" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: the lead is consumed in the flames

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that, since the temple belongs to Yahweh and represents his presence, he will protect it and the people of Judah will be safe. Possible meanings for why "Temple of Yahweh" is repeated three times are 1) it was repeated for emphasis or 2) it was repeated as part of a temple liturgy. Alternate translation: "This is the temple of Yahweh so it is absolutely certain that no one will destroy it and we are safe." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Temple of Yahweh! Temple of Yahweh! Temple of Yahweh!

contextId.occurrenceNote: This was the name of a false god. Alternate translation: "the false god known as 'the queen of the heavens'" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the queen of the heavens

contextId.occurrenceNote: The implied information is that this is a question that the people of Judah should have been asking. It can be translated as a statement. Alternate translation: "I have done a terrible thing." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rquestion]])
contextId.glQuote: What have I done?

contextId.occurrenceNote: The implied information is that these types of birds know the right times to migrate, which means to fly from one place to another at different times of the year for feeding or breeding. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Even the stork in heaven knows the right times; and the doves, swifts, and cranes

contextId.occurrenceNote: The implied information is that the people should have naturally known Yahweh's decrees. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: They go on their migrations at the right time, but my people do not know Yahweh's decrees

contextId.occurrenceNote: This describes the people crying a lot. Alternate translation: "so we will cry very hard with tears flowing from our eyes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: so our eyes may run with tears and our eyelids flow with water

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to people knowing Yahweh and his ways. Alternate translation: "Because people should understand that I am Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: For I am Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that he causes the mists to evaporate and form clouds. The phrase "the ends of the earth" refers to all of the earth. Alternate translation: "he causes clouds to form over every part of the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: he brings up the mists from the ends of the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here Yahweh speaks of his people as his "prized possession." Alternate translation: "Have not my people, who are my prized possession" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Has not my prized possession

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that the cities will be surrounded by their enemies, who will not allow anyone to go in or come out of the cities. Alternate translation: "The cities in the Negev will be shut up, and no one will be able to go into them or come out of them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: The cities in the Negev will be shut up, with no one to open them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers an enemy army that will come from the north. Alternate translation: "the enemy army coming from the north" or "the enemy army marching from the north" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the ones coming from the north

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that there is no grass for the deer to eat. Alternate translation: "for there is no grass for them to eat" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: for there is no grass

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is another name for Yahweh. Alternate translation: "You are the hope of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Hope of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that Yahweh did not send them out with messages to give to the people. Alternate translation: "I did not send them to prophesy to other people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I did not send them out

contextId.occurrenceNote: It may be helpful to state what they do not know. Alternate translation: "they do not know what they are doing" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: they do not know

contextId.occurrenceNote: This implies that they are pleading for Yahweh to spare the people. Alternate translation: "were standing in front of me pleading for these people, I would still not be in favor of them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: were standing in front of me, I would still not be in favor of this people

contextId.occurrenceNote: Manasseh was a very wicked king who did many evil things in Jerusalem. Alternate translation: "because of the wicked things that Manasseh ... did in Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: because of what Manasseh ... did in Jerusalem

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that Yahweh will send an enemy army to kill young men, which will cause their mothers great sorrow. Alternate translation: "At noonday I will send an enemy army to destroy young men and cause their mothers to weep" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Against the mothers of young men I will send the destroyer at noonday

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to lending money to people. Often lending money causes people to fight with one another. Alternate translation: "I have not lent money to anyone, nor has anyone lent money to me" or "I have not made anyone angry by lending or borrow money and then quarreling about it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I have not lent, nor has anyone lent to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jeremiah is asking Yahweh not to be patient with the sins of his enemies. The phrase "take me away" refers to him being killed. Alternate translation: "Please do not continue to be patient with them and allow them to kill me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
contextId.glQuote: You are patient, but do not allow them to take me away

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "words" represents messages that the prophets speak from Yahweh. Alternate translation: "words of Yahweh from the prophets" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: words from the prophets

contextId.occurrenceNote: These gates are the gates of the king's palace. Alternate translation: "your people who come to visit the king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: your people who come through these gates

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jehoiachin has several sons. This phrase, then, means it is as if he was childless. His children will not succeed him as king. Alternate translation: "It will be as if he did not have any children" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: He will be childless

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to Israel, from where they were scattered. This can be stated explicitly. Alternate translation: "Then they will live in their own land again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Then they will live in their own land

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is understood that they are prophesying falsely. This can be made explicit. Alternate translation: "they have prophesied falsely anyway" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: they have still prophesied

contextId.occurrenceNote: They meant that this dream was from God. This can be made explicit. Alternate translation: "I had a dream from Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I had a dream!

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "him" refers to Yahweh. Possible meanings for the phrase "the work of your hands" are 1) it is a reference to the idols that the people have made with their hands. Alternate translation: "do not provoke Yahweh with the idols that you have made" or 2) It is an idiom that refers to the actions of a person, with the word "hands" being a synecdoche that represents the person who does those actions. Alternate translation: "do not provoke Yahweh by the things that you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: do not provoke him with the work of your hands

contextId.occurrenceNote: See how you translated a similar phrase in [Jeremiah 25:6](../25/06.md). Possible meanings for the phrase "the work of your hands" are 1) it is a reference to the idols that the people have made with their hands. Alternate translation: "you have provoked me to harm you because of the idols that you have made with your hands" or 2) It is an idiom that refers to the actions of a person, with the word "hands" being a synecdoche that represents the person who does those actions. Alternate translation: "you have provoked me to harm you because of the things that you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: you have provoked me with the work of your hands to do harm to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: It can be stated clearly who Yahweh gave this message to. Alternate translation: "this word came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying" or "Yahweh spoke this message to Jeremiah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: this word came from Yahweh, saying

contextId.occurrenceNote: You may need to make explicit the nature of the time. Alternate translation: "the time for me to destroy his land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the time for his land comes

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh is telling them they will be there for a long time. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Build houses and live in them. Plant gardens and eat their fruit

contextId.occurrenceNote: This implies that Yahweh will give them what they want. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I will listen to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: You may need to make explicit what it was that Jeremiah sent. Alternate translation: "he has sent a message to us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: he has sent to us

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here this refers to the people of Judah. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the time before the exile to Babylon. This can be made explicit. Alternate translation: "to what they were before I sent the Israelites into exile in Babylon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: to what they were before

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the practice of a shepherd counting and inspecting his sheep as the sheep walked under his hand. Alternate translation: "shepherds will again count their sheep as the sheep walk by" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the flocks will again pass under the hands of the ones counting them

contextId.occurrenceNote: The people of Judah think that they will be safe because the Chaldeans had left. Alternate translation: "Surely we are safe because the Chaldeans are leaving us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Surely the Chaldeans are leaving us

contextId.occurrenceNote: They sent them out to get Jeremiah. This can be stated explicitly. Alternate translation: "sent men out to get Jeremiah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: sent men out

contextId.occurrenceNote: You may need to make explicit which people the speaker is speaking of. Alternate translation: "among the people who remained in Judah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: among the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that they would give their provisions to Ishmael and his men. Alternate translation: "for we will give you our provisions that we have hidden in a field" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: for there are provisions of ours in a field

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that they were afraid that the Chaldeans would attack them. Alternate translation: "because they thought the Chaldeans may attack them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: because of the Chaldeans

contextId.occurrenceNote: They desired to live in Egypt. This can be stated explicitly. Alternate translation: "in Egypt, where you thought you would be safe" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: in the place where you desired to go to live

contextId.occurrenceNote: This a title of a false goddess that the people of Judah worshiped. This goddess is also called "Asherah." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: queen of heaven

contextId.occurrenceNote: The people of Judah thought they would prosper because the queen of heaven would bless them if they worshiped her. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Then we will be filled with food and will prosper, without experiencing any disaster

contextId.occurrenceNote: Why people burn incense can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "burned incense to false gods" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: burned incense

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the fourth year of Jehoiakim's reign. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "in the fourth year of the reign of Jehoiakim" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: in the fourth year of Jehoiakim

contextId.occurrenceNote: This command can be addressed directly to the soldiers. What they were to go out for can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "You soldiers from Cush and Put, who are skillful with your shields, go out to battle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Let the soldiers go out, Cush and Put, men skillful with a shield

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "the destroyer" represents the enemy army. Alternate translation: "For the enemy army will come to every city and destroy it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: For the destroyer will come to every city

contextId.occurrenceNote: For wine to taste good, it has to be left undisturbed for a long time and not poured from one pot to another. Yahweh compares the people of Moab, who are prosperous because no one has ever conquered them and taken them as captives, to wine that is undisturbed and has a good flavor. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: He is like his wine that has never been poured from pot to pot

contextId.occurrenceNote: The wine makers would stomp on the grapes to squeeze out the juice. Alternate translation: "The wine makers will not stomp the grapes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: They will not tread

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The enemy army has destroyed the people who worship Chemosh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Chemosh's people are destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "small" represents having the least political importance. Alternate translation: "made you least important" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: made you small

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that the people made homes in high places to remain safe from enemies. Alternate translation: "live in safety like an eagle in the heights of the mountains" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: so that you may make your nest high like an eagle

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh is speaking to the enemies of Babylon. Alternate translation: "You enemies of Babylon arrange yourselves against her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Arrange yourselves against Babylon

contextId.occurrenceNote: They will escape the destruction of Babylon. This can be stated explicitly. Alternate translation: "that I allow to escape the destruction of Babylon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: that I spare

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh is speaking to the enemies of Babylon. Alternate translation: "You enemies of Babylon, arise against the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Arise against the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh speaks this to the enemies of Babylon. This can be made clear. Alternate translation: "You enemies of Babylon, kill all her bulls" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Kill all her bulls

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh speaks this to the people of Babylon. This can be made clear. Alternate translation: "See, I am against you, people of Babylon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: See, I am against you

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh speaks to the people of Babylon. This can be made clear. Alternate translation: "See, people of Babylon, a people is coming" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: See, a people is coming
